content.text: Hyperfy is a web-based 3D platform with multiplayer capabilities that allows users to create and interact in virtual worlds. The platform combines technical sophistication with user-friendly development tools.

## Technical Features

- **Multiplayer Architecture**: Uses client/server code separation with `world.isClient` and `world.isServer` conditionals
- **Voice Communication**: Integrates LiveKit for voice chat and screen sharing functionality
- **Optimization**: Includes automatic instancing of avatars and models, LOD for animations
- **Particle Systems**: Supports particle effects that can be attached to bones and models
- **Spatial Audio**: Offers spatial audio capabilities that users find superior to Discord
- **Media Support**: Currently supports MP4 videos and m3u8 streams, with plans to add YouTube/Twitch via webviews
- **Blockchain Integration**: Capabilities for wallet connections and token staking

## Development Environment

- Described as "easier three.js" that's naturally optimized
- Requires proper environment setup including LiveKit configuration for voice features
- Supports custom domain names for completed experiences
- Player capacity depends on world content optimization, potentially reaching hundreds with well-optimized content

## Current Limitations and Upcoming Features

- Screen sharing supported but audio may have issues
- Limited streaming options (MP4, m3u8) with YouTube/Twitch support coming via webviews
- Mobile UI improvements ongoing, but build mode not confirmed for mobile
- Some users report issues with content persistence in the "Play World" environment
- Potential integration with MCP (Machine Consciousness Protocol) for AI capabilities

## Community Support

The Hyperfy team actively engages with users in Discord, providing troubleshooting assistance, implementation examples, and code snippets. Common help topics include particle system implementation, LiveKit integration, and media streaming options like Vimeo Pro and mux.com.

# Hyperfy Platform Overview

Hyperfy is a web-based 3D platform with multiplayer capabilities for creating virtual worlds. The platform offers various technical features and integration possibilities that were discussed across multiple Discord channels.

## Key Technical Features

- **Particle Systems**: Support for particle effects attached to bones and models, with spritesheet/flipbook capabilities
- **Multiplayer Architecture**: Uses client/server code separation with `world.isClient` and `world.isServer` conditionals
- **Voice Chat**: LiveKit integration for voice chat and screen sharing functionality
- **Optimization**: Automatic instancing of avatars and models, LOD for animations
- **UI**: Billboard UI interaction and chat bubble scaling based on distance
- **Blockchain**: Integration capabilities for wallet connections and token staking
- **AI Integration**: Examples include an Eliza app and potential MCP (Machine Consciousness Protocol) integration

## Media Capabilities

- **Video Support**: Currently supports MP4 videos and m3u8 streams
- **Streaming Options**: Vimeo Pro (with 2GB/month limit) and mux.com recommended
- **Technical Implementation**: Uses HLS.js for m3u8 support
- **Future Plans**: YouTube/Twitch support via webviews is planned
- **Screen Sharing**: Supported, though audio integration may need improvement

## Development Environment

- **Setup**: Requires proper environment variables for features like LiveKit
- **Mobile Support**: UI improvements for mobile users, though build mode availability on mobile is unclear
- **Tools**: Some users developing plugins for organizing 3D assets like VRM files
- **Optimization Suggestions**: AI remeshing and rebaking for 3D models

## Common Issues and Solutions

- **Particle Attachment**: Positioning particles correctly requires using `world.add(particles)` instead of `app.add(particles)`
- **Environment Setup**: Fresh installation may be needed when encountering package dependency errors
- **Content Persistence**: Issues reported with saving content in the "Play World" environment
- **Audio Limitations**: Need for room-specific audio boundaries in spatial audio implementation

## Feature Requests

- Display web content without screen sharing
- Improved "vibe coding" workflow with better Cursor integration
- Support for AI agent character files
- Parkour-style movement capabilities
- Tokenomics model for moderation with Harberger Taxes on plots
- Room-specific audio boundaries for spatial audio
